ğ“„¿ akbaba: (white)vulture

In old German Aar means eagle.
In many European countries AIR or variants means air (aero).
In Egypt the sign ğ“„¿ which has a reconstructed sound similar to 'air' also has the meaning eagle and air.

Adel Aar vs al'air lair (AdLer, Lerche(lark), â€¦ vs ğ“„¿ğ“…®ğ“…¯ğ“‡‹Luft)
